citations.narrative:
Although a physical exam was completed by the attending veterinarian within the required 12-month timeframe, the
attending veterinarian's visit to the premises exceeded the required timeframe by almost 3 weeks (20 days).
Regularly scheduled visits to the animal premises allow the attending veterinarian to assess the adequacy of veterinary
care, and ensure the health and well-being of dogs.
Visits by the attending veterinarian to all premises where dogs are kept should be performed not less than once every 12
months.
Corrected on February 11, 2023.

Although the licensee's Program of Veterinary Care for Dogs includes year-round administration of a monthly heartworm
preventative, this medication was not administered for a period of 6 months during 2022. Heartworm prevention was
reinstituted prior to inspection, with monthly medication administered in January and February, 2023. At the time of
inspection, medication for March 2023 was not yet due, but the licensee had medication in her possession, and a system
in place to comply with this aspect of the Program of Veterinary Care.
Antiparasitic treatments, as prescribed by the attending veterinarian, ensure the health and welfare of dogs.
Exhibitors must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that is developed, documented in writing, and
signed by the attending veterinarian. Treatment for parasites, including heartworm, must be performed in accordance
with the schedule approved by the attending veterinarian.
Corrected on January 18, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
3.13(a)(1)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Although a physical exam was completed by the attending veterinarian within the required 12-month timeframe, the 
attending veterinarian's visit to the premises exceeded the required timeframe by almost 3 weeks (20 days). 
 
Regularly scheduled visits to the animal premises allow the attending veterinarian to assess the adequacy of veterinary 
care, and ensure the health and well-being of dogs. 
 
Visits by the attending veterinarian to all premises where dogs are kept should be performed not less than once every 12 
months. 
 
Corrected on February 11, 2023. 
3.13(a)(3)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Although the licensee's Program of Veterinary Care for Dogs includes year-round administration of a monthly heartworm 
preventative, this medication was not administered for a period of 6 months during 2022.  Heartworm prevention was

reinstituted prior to inspection, with monthly medication administered in January and February, 2023.  At the time of 
inspection, medication for March 2023 was not yet due, but the licensee had medication in her possession, and a system 
in place to comply with this aspect of the Program of Veterinary Care. 
 
Antiparasitic treatments, as prescribed by the attending veterinarian, ensure the health and welfare of dogs. 
 
Exhibitors must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that is developed, documented in writing, and 
signed by the attending veterinarian.  Treatment for parasites, including heartworm, must be performed in accordance 
with the schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. 
 
Corrected on January 18, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End Section
